topic.title: How to Enable Code Syntax Highlight

body.p: This topic refers only to the pdf-css-html5 transformation type.
You can use syntax highlight to make your code snippets more readable. In the DITA topics set the outputclass attribute on the codeblock elements to one of these values:
For example, for a java snippet:
body.codeblock:
<codeblock outputclass="language-java">
   for (int i=0; i <100; i++) {
     // do something
   }
</codeblock>
body.p: The resulted HTML fragment in the merged HTML5 document is:
body.codeblock:
for 
       (int 
         i=0; i 
            <100; i++) {
     // do something
   }
body.p: And in the output it will be rendered as:

section.title: Changing the colors for the syntax highlight
section.p: As you can see in the above example, the HTML elements span and strong are used to color the content. Since the they have set a style attribute we need to mark the overriding properties with !important.
